result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Odegaard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-------------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
-------------------------------------

Must comply with any Family Court orders.
-------------------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
-------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on Saturday July 1st at 8:00 a.m. and WITH work release privileges.

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED

Court in session at 2:30pm. Appearances made. Defendant in court with Attorney Rebecca Hammock. ADA Johnson for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are present to proceed on Sentencing on Ct #5. Parties are free to argue on conditional jail time. Record made regarding juvenile court records. Family members present. 
2:31 pm - Family members speak on behalf of defendant. 
2:34 pm - ADA Johnson makes recommendation on sentencing and conditional jail time of 9-12 months w/ Huber. ADA Johnson recites narrative of report filed. ADA Johnson summarizes defendants criminal history.
2:41 pm - Atty Hammock argues that the  jail time time be Stayed. Atty Hammock makes statement as to defendants progress on rehabilitation.
2:45 pm - Mr. Odegaard makes statement.
2:48 pm - Court has questions for defendant.
2:51 pm - Court goes over sentencing objectives and factors.
2:56 pm - Court adopts joint recommendation. Court gives notice of restriction of voting and firearms.

3 years Prison - 1 year Initial Confinement, 2 years Extended Supervision IMPOSED AND STAYED
2 years Probation w/ following conditions:
Conditional Jail Time - 30 days WITH work release privileges. Must report to Jail on Saturday July 1st at 8:00 a.m.
No alcohol.
No drugs.
No weapons.
Counseling as recommend per Agent.
Must comply with any Family Court orders.
DNA surcharge and sample (previously submitted)
Not eligible for CIP and SAP 
1 day deadtime if probation is revoked

3:01 pm - Court in recess.
E-mails between Clerk and Attys, re:  rescheduling of sentencing hearing
4/19/2017 Letter from Atty Hammock requesting sentencing hearing be adjourned to a date after May 18th.

9:46 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant Christopher L Odegaard in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court recites charge and maximum potential penalties.  
Court understands parties are making a joint recommendation for 3 years in prison; 1 yr IC followed by 2 years ES - STAYED for 2 years of probation and parties are free to argue.  
Attorney Donohoo advises that they have an agreement as to sentence with the exception of conditional jail time.  
Atty Hammock indicates she is prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Court makes record as to documents it reviewed in preparation for this hearing including Atty Donohoo's e-mail sent yesterday.  
Attorney Donohoo makes record with regard to a juvenile court records that were attached to the defense sentencing memorandum.  
Response by Attorney Hammock.  
9:50 am  Court makes records that if the defense wants the Court to consider the juvenile record for sentencing, then this sentencing hearing will need to be reset so Atty Hammock can get release from the juvenile court to obtain that record.   Sentencing hearing rescheduled for May 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.  9:52 am  Court in recess.
E-mail from ADA Donohoo, re:  Juvenile court records submitted by the Defense in its sentencing memorandum

*ADMENDMENT 9-21-15: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH D.R.O. AND/OR B.J.M IF SUPERVISED BY WALWORTH COUNTY HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES AND/OR ANY OTHER TREATMENT PROVIDER FOR COUNSELING AND TREATMENT SESSIONS WHEN REQUESTED BY COUNSELOR OR TREATMENT PROVIDER.*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.R.O., 05/10/2004 OR WITH B.J.M. OR THEIR RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Atty Travis Schwantes
